citation.article-title: Citreicella thiooxidans gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel lithoheterotrophic sulfur-oxidizing bacterium from the Black Sea

p.s: Description of Citreicella thiooxidans sp. nov.
C. thiooxidans (thi.o.ox.i′ dans. Gr. n. thium sulfur; M. L. v. oxido oxidize; M. L. part adj. thiooxidans oxidizing sulfur).
Cells are 0.6–0.8×1–1.5 μm, occurring in pairs and short chains.
Capsules are formed during growth on defined media.
Forms PHB granules as storage material.
Bacteriochlorophyll a and other pigments are absent.
Oxidizes thiosulfate, sulfide and sulfur to sulfate and able to gain metabolic energy from inorganic sulfur oxidation during heterotrophic growth.

The following substrates are utilized during heterotrophic growth: acetate, succinate, malate, lactate, pyruvate, citrate, propionate, butyrate, gluconate, glycolate, glyoxylate, ethanol, glycerol, mannitol, sorbitol, d-glucose, d-fructose, maltose, sucrose, l-arabinose, d-cellobiose, starch, prolyne, lysine, alanine, glutamate, glutamine, aspartate, asparagine, leucine, arginine.
Growth was not observed with methanol, formate, methylamine, benzoate, d-ribose, d-galactose, d-melibiose, casein, Tween-80, aromatic aminoacids, treonine, serine, valine.
Unable to ferment glucose and to grow anaerobically under denitrifying conditions.
Growth occurs at 8–35 °C (opt.25–28), pH 6.5–8.5 (opt.7.5–7.8) and 5–60 g l−1 NaCl (opt. 20).
The type strain CHLG 1T (=DSM 10146, UNIQEM 228) was isolated from the Black Sea oxygen-sulfide interface.
The GenBank accession numbers for the 16S rDNA sequence of strains CHLG 1T and CHLG 16 and CHLG 11 are AY639887, AY639888 and AY639889, respectively.
